WRITING.TEXT: The routine vaccination against small pox has been stopped since 1977 ( so general public is not immune to it )and I'm not sure how much small pox vaccine is available in stockpile

First of all ,accept that overcoming social anxiety requires patience and you couldn't become the life of a party in a matter of minutes .Secondly ,try to appear confident ( don't overanalyse what other people will think about you if you say something or inadvertently make some mistake ),take interest in other people's lives .Begin with light chat and gradually move towards serious conversation ( awkward silences are ok and you can't be a people pleaser ) .Please remember that we are all humans ,most of us feel nervous in company of other people ( if we are introverts ) so it's nothing to worry about .
An epidemic which has been long eradicated and therefore we have no vaccine : small pox

What a realistic depiction of daily life ,cellphone charging ,milk coming to boil and the kitchen sponge left carelessly near sink.However ,as there is no person in the picture ,the vibes coming are bit sad and lonely !
Dr Freeman believed that excess of emotions causes mental maladies,and by severing nerves in the brain,he could tamp down these excessive emotions,thus stabilising the person
Revenge could be cold Mocha frappuccino by this definition !

Greetings ,I'm a doctor by profession and extremely interested in knowing about the traditional medicine and long forgotten medical techniques .In South Asia ,papaya leaves ( especially their extract ) is extensively used for its anti viral properties ( I've myself used it in Dengue fever,and witnessed it's incredible results ).Are you aware of any research done on papaya leaves for this purpose ?

WRITING.TEXT: I've read that somewhere The sharpest minds often ruin their lives by overthinking the next step, while the dull win the race with eyes closed.
Don't overthink and overanalyse ( I know it's easy to say but difficult to act upon for someone suffering from anxiety) .Don't fret about little social faux pas ( we are humans and we make mistakes)

I think that the best tactic is to ignore this girl ,she is an attention seeker ( and actually suffering from low self esteem ).She is either trying to grab your attention or to annoy you .Just don't show that you are bothered by her childish acts .However ,after a while ,if she continues to do the same ,talk to her in order to gently remind her that she's not the centre of the world .If she want to work with you ,she'll have to mind her manners

WRITING.TITLE: "Books are like mirrors: if a fool looks in, you cannot expect a genius to look out." by JK Rowling
